tools.name: boot_sim
tools.description: Boots an iOS simulator.

tools.name: build_device
tools.description: Builds an app for a connected device.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path to derived data directory

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional arguments to pass to xcodebuild

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: Prefer xcodebuild over faster alternatives

tools.name: build_macos
tools.description: Builds a macOS app.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional xcodebuild arguments

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system

tools.name: build_run_macos
tools.description: Builds and runs a macOS app.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional xcodebuild arguments

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system

tools.name: build_run_sim
tools.description: Builds and runs an app on an iOS simulator.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional xcodebuild arguments

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

tools.name: build_sim
tools.description: Builds an app for an iOS simulator.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional xcodebuild arguments

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

tools.name: button
tools.description: Press hardware button on iOS simulator. Supported buttons: apple-pay, home, lock, side-button, siri

tools.name: clean
tools.description: Cleans build products with xcodebuild.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Optional: Path where derived data might be located

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional xcodebuild arguments

args.name: platform
args.description: Optional: Platform to clean for (defaults to iOS). Choose from macOS, iOS, iOS Simulator, watchOS, watchOS Simulator, tvOS, tvOS Simulator, visionOS, visionOS Simulator

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

tools.name: debug_attach_sim
tools.description: Attach LLDB to a running iOS simulator app. Provide bundleId or pid, plus simulator defaults.

args.name: bundleId
args.description: Bundle identifier of the app to attach (e.g., 'com.example.MyApp')

args.name: continueOnAttach
args.description: Resume execution automatically after attaching (default: true)

args.name: makeCurrent
args.description: Set this debug session as the current session (default: true)

args.name: pid
args.description: Process ID to attach directly

args.name: waitFor
args.description: Wait for the process to appear when attaching

tools.name: debug_breakpoint_add
tools.description: Add a breakpoint by file/line or function name for the active debug session.

args.name: condition
args.description: Optional condition expression for the breakpoint

args.name: debugSessionId
args.description: Debug session ID to target (defaults to current session)

args.name: function
args.description: Function name to break on

args.name: line
args.description: Line number for breakpoint

tools.name: debug_breakpoint_remove
tools.description: Remove a breakpoint by id for the active debug session.

args.name: breakpointId
args.description: Breakpoint id to remove

args.name: debugSessionId
args.description: Debug session ID to target (defaults to current session)

tools.name: debug_continue
tools.description: Resume execution in the active debug session or a specific debugSessionId.

args.name: debugSessionId
args.description: Debug session ID to resume (defaults to current session)

tools.name: debug_detach
tools.description: Detach the current debugger session or a specific debugSessionId.

args.name: debugSessionId
args.description: Debug session ID to detach (defaults to current session)

tools.name: debug_lldb_command
tools.description: Run an arbitrary LLDB command within the active debug session.

tools.name: debug_stack
tools.description: Return a thread backtrace from the active debug session.

args.name: debugSessionId
args.description: Debug session ID to target (defaults to current session)

args.name: maxFrames
args.description: Maximum frames to return

args.name: threadIndex
args.description: Thread index for backtrace

tools.name: debug_variables
tools.description: Return variables for a selected frame in the active debug session.

args.name: debugSessionId
args.description: Debug session ID to target (defaults to current session)

args.name: frameIndex
args.description: Frame index to inspect

tools.name: snapshot_ui
tools.description: Gets entire view hierarchy with precise frame coordinates (x, y, width, height) for all visible elements. Use this before UI interactions or after layout changes - do NOT guess coordinates from screenshots. Returns JSON tree with frame data for accurate automation. Requires the target process to be running; paused debugger/breakpoints can yield an empty tree.

tools.name: discover_projs
tools.description: Scans a directory (defaults to workspace root) to find Xcode project (.xcodeproj) and workspace (.xcworkspace) files.

args.name: maxDepth
args.description: Optional: Maximum directory depth to scan. Defaults to ${DEFAULT_MAX_DEPTH}.

args.name: scanPath
args.description: Optional: Path relative to workspace root to scan. Defaults to workspace root.

args.name: workspaceRoot
args.description: The absolute path of the workspace root to scan within.

tools.name: doctor
tools.description: Provides comprehensive information about the MCP server environment, available dependencies, and configuration status.

args.name: enabled
args.description: Optional: dummy parameter to satisfy MCP protocol

tools.name: erase_sims
tools.description: Erases a simulator by UDID.

args.name: shutdownFirst
args.description: If true, shuts down the simulator before erasing.

tools.name: gesture
tools.description: Perform gesture on iOS simulator using preset gestures: scroll-up, scroll-down, scroll-left, scroll-right, swipe-from-left-edge, swipe-from-right-edge, swipe-from-top-edge, swipe-from-bottom-edge

args.name: delta
args.description: Optional: Distance to move in pixels.

args.name: duration
args.description: Optional: Duration of the gesture in seconds.

args.name: postDelay
args.description: Optional: Delay after completing the gesture in seconds.

args.name: preDelay
args.description: Optional: Delay before starting the gesture in seconds.

args.name: preset
args.description: The gesture preset to perform. Must be one of: scroll-up, scroll-down, scroll-left, scroll-right, swipe-from-left-edge, swipe-from-right-edge, swipe-from-top-edge, swipe-from-bottom-edge.

args.name: screenHeight
args.description: Optional: Screen height in pixels. Used for gesture calculations. Auto-detected if not provided.

args.name: screenWidth
args.description: Optional: Screen width in pixels. Used for gesture calculations. Auto-detected if not provided.

tools.name: get_app_bundle_id
tools.description: Extracts the bundle identifier from an app bundle (.app) for any Apple platform (iOS, iPadOS, watchOS, tvOS, visionOS). IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: get_app_bundle_id({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' })

args.name: appPath
args.description: Path to the .app bundle to extract bundle ID from (full path to the .app directory)

tools.name: get_device_app_path
tools.description: Retrieves the built app path for a connected device.

args.name: platform
args.description: Target platform (defaults to iOS)

tools.name: get_mac_app_path
tools.description: Retrieves the built macOS app bundle path.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path to derived data directory

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional arguments to pass to xcodebuild

tools.name: get_mac_bundle_id
tools.description: Extracts the bundle identifier from a macOS app bundle (.app). IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: get_mac_bundle_id({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' }) Note: In some environments, this tool may be prefixed as mcp0_get_macos_bundle_id.

args.name: appPath
args.description: Path to the macOS .app bundle to extract bundle ID from (full path to the .app directory)

tools.name: get_sim_app_path
tools.description: Retrieves the built app path for an iOS simulator.

args.name: platform
args.description: Target simulator platform (Required)

tools.name: install_app_device
tools.description: Installs an app on a connected device.

args.name: appPath
args.description: Path to the .app bundle to install (full path to the .app directory)

tools.name: install_app_sim
tools.description: Installs an app in an iOS simulator.

args.name: appPath
args.description: Path to the .app bundle to install (full path to the .app directory)

tools.name: key_press
tools.description: Press a single key by keycode on the simulator. Common keycodes: 40=Return, 42=Backspace, 43=Tab, 44=Space, 58-67=F1-F10.

tools.name: key_sequence
tools.description: Press key sequence using HID keycodes on iOS simulator with configurable delay

tools.name: launch_app_device
tools.description: Launches an app on a connected device.

args.name: bundleId
args.description: Bundle identifier of the app to launch (e.g., "com.example.MyApp")

tools.name: launch_app_logs_sim
tools.description: Launches an app in an iOS simulator and captures its logs.

args.name: args
args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the app

args.name: bundleId
args.description: Bundle identifier of the app to launch (e.g., 'com.example.MyApp')

tools.name: launch_app_sim
tools.description: Launches an app in an iOS simulator.

args.name: args
args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the app

args.name: bundleId
args.description: Bundle identifier of the app to launch (e.g., 'com.example.MyApp')

tools.name: launch_mac_app
tools.description: Launches a macOS application. IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: launch_mac_app({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' }) Note: In some environments, this tool may be prefixed as mcp0_launch_macos_app.

args.name: appPath
args.description: Path to the macOS .app bundle to launch (full path to the .app directory)

args.name: args
args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the app

tools.name: list_devices
tools.description: Lists connected physical Apple devices (iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, Apple TV, Apple Vision Pro) with their UUIDs, names, and connection status. Use this to discover physical devices for testing.

tools.name: list_schemes
tools.description: Lists schemes for a project or workspace.

tools.name: list_sims
tools.description: Lists available iOS simulators with their UUIDs.

args.name: enabled
args.description: Optional flag to enable the listing operation.

tools.name: long_press
tools.description: Long press at specific coordinates for given duration (ms). Use snapshot_ui for precise coordinates (don't guess from screenshots).

tools.name: open_sim
tools.description: Opens the iOS Simulator app.

tools.name: record_sim_video
tools.description: Starts or stops video capture for an iOS simulator.

args.name: fps
args.description: Frames per second (default 30)

args.name: outputFile
args.description: Destination MP4 path to move the recorded video to on stop

args.name: start
args.description: Start recording if true

args.name: stop
args.description: Stop recording if true

tools.name: reset_sim_location
tools.description: Resets the simulator's location to default.

tools.name: scaffold_ios_project
tools.description: Scaffold a new iOS project from templates. Creates a modern Xcode project with workspace structure, SPM package for features, and proper iOS configuration.

args.name: bundleIdentifier
args.description: Bundle identifier (e.g., com.example.myapp). If not provided, will use com.example.projectname

args.name: currentProjectVersion
args.description: Build number (e.g., 1, 42, 100). If not provided, will use 1

args.name: customizeNames
args.description: Whether to customize project names and identifiers. Default is true.

args.name: deploymentTarget
args.description: iOS deployment target (e.g., 18.4, 17.0). If not provided, will use 18.4

args.name: displayName
args.description: App display name (shown on home screen/dock). If not provided, will use projectName

args.name: marketingVersion
args.description: Marketing version (e.g., 1.0, 2.1.3). If not provided, will use 1.0

args.name: outputPath
args.description: Path where the project should be created

args.name: projectName
args.description: Name of the new project

args.name: supportedOrientations
args.description: Supported orientations for iPhone

args.name: supportedOrientationsIpad
args.description: Supported orientations for iPad

args.name: targetedDeviceFamily
args.description: Targeted device families

tools.name: scaffold_macos_project
tools.description: Scaffold a new macOS project from templates. Creates a modern Xcode project with workspace structure, SPM package for features, and proper macOS configuration.

args.name: bundleIdentifier
args.description: Bundle identifier (e.g., com.example.myapp). If not provided, will use com.example.projectname

args.name: currentProjectVersion
args.description: Build number (e.g., 1, 42, 100). If not provided, will use 1

args.name: customizeNames
args.description: Whether to customize project names and identifiers. Default is true.

args.name: deploymentTarget
args.description: macOS deployment target (e.g., 15.4, 14.0). If not provided, will use 15.4

args.name: displayName
args.description: App display name (shown on home screen/dock). If not provided, will use projectName

args.name: marketingVersion
args.description: Marketing version (e.g., 1.0, 2.1.3). If not provided, will use 1.0

args.name: outputPath
args.description: Path where the project should be created

args.name: projectName
args.description: Name of the new project

tools.name: screenshot
tools.description: Captures screenshot for visual verification. For UI coordinates, use snapshot_ui instead (don't determine coordinates from screenshots).

tools.name: session-clear-defaults
tools.description: Clear selected or all session defaults.

tools.name: session-set-defaults
tools.description: Set the session defaults needed by many tools. Most tools require one or more session defaults to be set before they can be used. Agents should set all relevant defaults up front in a single call (e.g., project/workspace, scheme, simulator or device ID, useLatestOS) to avoid iterative prompts; only set the keys your workflow needs.

args.name: arch
args.description: Target architecture for macOS builds.

args.name: configuration
args.description: Build configuration, e.g. Debug or Release.

args.name: deviceId
args.description: Physical device ID for device workflows.

args.name: projectPath
args.description: Xcode project (.xcodeproj) path. Mutually exclusive with workspacePath. Required for most build/test tools when workspacePath is not set.

args.name: scheme
args.description: Xcode scheme. Required by most build/test tools. Use list_schemes to discover available schemes before setting.

args.name: simulatorId
args.description: Simulator UUID for simulator workflows. Preferred over simulatorName when both are provided.

args.name: simulatorName
args.description: Simulator device name for simulator workflows. If simulatorId is also provided, simulatorId is preferred and simulatorName is ignored.

args.name: suppressWarnings
args.description: When true, warning messages are filtered from build output to conserve context

args.name: useLatestOS
args.description: When true, prefer the latest available OS for simulatorName lookups.

args.name: workspacePath
args.description: Xcode workspace (.xcworkspace) path. Mutually exclusive with projectPath. Required for most build/test tools when projectPath is not set.

tools.name: session-show-defaults
tools.description: Show current session defaults.

tools.name: set_sim_appearance
tools.description: Sets the appearance mode (dark/light) of an iOS simulator.

args.name: mode
args.description: The appearance mode to set (either "dark" or "light")

tools.name: set_sim_location
tools.description: Sets a custom GPS location for the simulator.

args.name: latitude
args.description: The latitude for the custom location.

args.name: longitude
args.description: The longitude for the custom location.

tools.name: show_build_settings
tools.description: Shows xcodebuild build settings.

tools.name: sim_statusbar
tools.description: Sets the data network indicator in the iOS simulator status bar. Use "clear" to reset all overrides, or specify a network type (hide, wifi, 3g, 4g, lte, lte-a, lte+, 5g, 5g+, 5g-uwb, 5g-uc).

args.name: dataNetwork
args.description: Data network type to display in status bar. Use "clear" to reset all overrides. Valid values: clear, hide, wifi, 3g, 4g, lte, lte-a, lte+, 5g, 5g+, 5g-uwb, 5g-uc.

tools.name: start_device_log_cap
tools.description: Starts log capture on a connected device.

args.name: bundleId
args.description: Bundle identifier of the app to launch and capture logs for.

tools.name: start_sim_log_cap
tools.description: Starts capturing logs from a specified simulator. Returns a session ID. Use subsystemFilter to control what logs are captured: 'app' (default), 'all' (everything), 'swiftui' (includes Self._printChanges()), or custom subsystems.

args.name: bundleId
args.description: Bundle identifier of the app to capture logs for.

args.name: captureConsole
args.description: Whether to capture console output (requires app relaunch).

args.name: subsystemFilter
args.description: Controls which log subsystems to capture. Options: 'app' (default, only app logs), 'all' (capture all system logs), 'swiftui' (app + SwiftUI logs for Self._printChanges()), or an array of custom subsystem strings.

tools.name: stop_app_device
tools.description: Stops a running app on a connected device.

args.name: processId
args.description: Process ID (PID) of the app to stop

tools.name: stop_app_sim
tools.description: Stops an app running in an iOS simulator.

args.name: bundleId
args.description: Bundle identifier of the app to stop (e.g., 'com.example.MyApp')

tools.name: stop_device_log_cap
tools.description: Stops an active Apple device log capture session and returns the captured logs.

args.name: logSessionId
args.description: The session ID returned by start_device_log_cap.

tools.name: stop_mac_app
tools.description: Stops a running macOS application. Can stop by app name or process ID.

args.name: appName
args.description: Name of the application to stop (e.g., "Calculator" or "MyApp")

args.name: processId
args.description: Process ID (PID) of the application to stop

tools.name: stop_sim_log_cap
tools.description: Stops an active simulator log capture session and returns the captured logs.

args.name: logSessionId
args.description: The session ID returned by start_sim_log_cap.

tools.name: swift_package_build
tools.description: Builds a Swift Package with swift build

args.name: architectures
args.description: Target architectures to build for

args.name: configuration
args.description: Swift package configuration (debug, release)

args.name: packagePath
args.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

args.name: parseAsLibrary
args.description: Build as library instead of executable

args.name: targetName
args.description: Optional target to build

tools.name: swift_package_clean
tools.description: Cleans Swift Package build artifacts and derived data

args.name: packagePath
args.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

tools.name: swift_package_list
tools.description: Lists currently running Swift Package processes

tools.name: swift_package_run
tools.description: Runs an executable target from a Swift Package with swift run

args.name: arguments
args.description: Arguments to pass to the executable

args.name: background
args.description: Run in background and return immediately (default: false)

args.name: configuration
args.description: Build configuration: 'debug' (default) or 'release'

args.name: executableName
args.description: Name of executable to run (defaults to package name)

args.name: packagePath
args.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

args.name: parseAsLibrary
args.description: Add -parse-as-library flag for @main support (default: false)

args.name: timeout
args.description: Timeout in seconds (default: 30, max: 300)

tools.name: swift_package_stop
tools.description: Stops a running Swift Package executable started with swift_package_run

args.name: pid
args.description: Process ID (PID) of the running executable

tools.name: swift_package_test
tools.description: Runs tests for a Swift Package with swift test

args.name: configuration
args.description: Swift package configuration (debug, release)

args.name: filter
args.description: Filter tests by name (regex pattern)

args.name: packagePath
args.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

args.name: parallel
args.description: Run tests in parallel (default: true)

args.name: parseAsLibrary
args.description: Add -parse-as-library flag for @main support (default: false)

args.name: showCodecov
args.description: Show code coverage (default: false)

args.name: testProduct
args.description: Optional specific test product to run

tools.name: swipe
tools.description: Swipe between points.

tools.name: tap
tools.description: Tap coordinate or element.

tools.name: test_device
tools.description: Runs tests on a physical Apple device.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path to derived data directory

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional arguments to pass to xcodebuild

args.name: platform
args.description: Target platform (defaults to iOS)

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: Prefer xcodebuild over faster alternatives

args.name: testRunnerEnv
args.description: Environment variables to pass to the test runner (TEST_RUNNER_ prefix added automatically)

tools.name: test_macos
tools.description: Runs tests for a macOS target.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional xcodebuild arguments

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system

args.name: testRunnerEnv
args.description: Environment variables to pass to the test runner (TEST_RUNNER_ prefix added automatically)

tools.name: test_sim
tools.description: Runs tests on an iOS simulator.

args.name: derivedDataPath
args.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

args.name: extraArgs
args.description: Additional xcodebuild arguments

args.name: preferXcodebuild
args.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

args.name: testRunnerEnv
args.description: Environment variables to pass to the test runner (TEST_RUNNER_ prefix added automatically)

tools.name: touch
tools.description: Perform touch down/up events at specific coordinates. Use snapshot_ui for precise coordinates (don't guess from screenshots).

tools.name: type_text
tools.description: Type text (supports US keyboard characters). Use snapshot_ui to find text field, tap to focus, then type.
